summary: This is a notification from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the denial of Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for bail in her criminal case. The document shows the court's decision to keep Maxwell detained pending appeal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the appellant in the case who filed a motion for bail that was denied by the court.

persons.name: PNL
persons.context: One of the judges listed on the motion order denying Maxwell's bail request.

persons.name: RJL
persons.context: One of the judges listed on the motion order denying Maxwell's bail request.

persons.name: RJS
persons.context: One of the judges listed on the motion order denying Maxwell's bail request.

events.title: Bail Motion Denied for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for bail, keeping her detained while her appeal proceeds.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for bail was denied by the Second Circuit Court of Appeals on April 27, 2021.
The case numbers referenced are 21-58 and 21-770, indicating multiple appeals or related proceedings.
The document shows Maxwell remained in custody during her appeal process.
The order was issued by a panel of three judges identified as PNL, RJL, and RJS.
